intro: Lophatherum sinense f. leiophyllum, commonly known as the smooth-leafed lophatherum, is a herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Poaceae family, commonly referred to as grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wet meadows. Its leaves are narrow and have a smooth texture, distinguishing it from other varieties of the species. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
